DataElement.preferredName: Oral Verrucous Lesion Disease Additional Comment Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether there is any additional information about oral warts (verrucous lesions).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Oral Verrucous Lesion Disease Additional Comment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to additional (added, extra, further) comments (written explanations, observations or criticisms added to textual material) on an oral (of or relating to or affecting the mouth) wart (verrucous lesion; a raised growth on the surface of the skin or other organ).

ObjectClass.preferredName: Oral Verrucous Lesion Diseases and Disorders
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Oral; of, or relating to, or affecting, or for use in the mouth.:A raised growth on the surface of the skin or other organ.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Of, or relating to, or affecting, or for use in the mouth.
A papillomavirus related epithelial overgrowth. It can be located anywhere on the body though when it involves the perineal region it is generally referred to as condyloma acuminatum.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Added; extra. (from American Heritage Dictionary):A written explanation, observation or criticism added to textual material.

Concepts.definition: A written explanation, observation or criticism added to textual material.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
